intro: Randia umbellata, commonly known as the clustered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Randia umbellata is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
